title: What are the best ways to study business? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several things you'll want to do. Start a business The most important thing is to start a business of your own. If you want to be successful in business, you'll need to learn a lot, and the fastest and best way to learn is by doing. So start something simple that you can manage on your own. Perhaps use Wix to create your own website and sell some product. It really doesn't matter what—you just want the experience of trying to get the marketplace to respond to you. Having a business will also allow you to experiment with all the knowledge you'll be learning from your studies. By putting things into practice, you'll remember them a lot better than all the other students in your business school. Read booksRead the great classics of business. For instance, Warren Buffet recommends reading Business Adventures by John Brooks. Buffet's advice is worth following. Others you should read: Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill The Effective Executive by Peter Drucker The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen Covey Good to Great by Jim Collins Influence by Robert Cialdini How to Win Friends and Influence People by Dale Carnegie Go to business schoolA good business school will teach you all the nuts and bolts about business, but the most important thing you'll get is exposure to great businessmen and women. Your professors will share the stories of the victories and defeats. You'll be introduced to CEOs and other high-power players and build a strong network of people who will do great things in business.  These connections are awesome and you'll have a hard time replicating these advantages without business school. Also, study hard. Read your textbooks and apply their knowledge to your simple business that you started. Start attending Chamber of Commerce and other city meetingsIf you want to know how a lot of business gets done, start attending local Chamber of Commerce events, downtown partnership meetings, and other city events where all the movers and shakers show up. Good business people like to get to know each other and help each other out. They're also very philanthropic and focused on improving the communities in which they live. By getting involved with these scene, you'll gain a lot of good connections, get your name out there, and you'll also make a difference in your community. Read business journalsLast but not least, read business journals such as the Harvard Business Review, Bloomberg, Fortune and other publications. If you want to be a businessperson, you should speak the language and keep your fingers on the pulse of the economy. Reading business journals will help you. If you do all this, especially as a student, you will be miles ahead of most people who want to go into business.

Read everything! Read business magazines, books, follow sites that share interesting trends, such as CB Insights, or daily feeds from others. It’s a continuing education process. Take business classes, attend workshops. There aren’t enough people in business who understand basic economics and the value of self-interest in customers, employees, shareholder and suppliers. There is no one way to run a company or to build an empire, but think of reading and learning is a way of adding tools to your shop no differently than a carpenter would add tools to theirs. The more you know, the easier it is to leverage that knowledge into a success. It doesn’t matter how old you are, there is always something to learn and that’s the fun! If you’re bored, well that’s on you because there are so many aspects to business, that one of them has to grab you. When I was in school, I never ever imagined having this much fun and even in the scariest, worst moments, I was still glad I was doing something that meant something to me.
